entry.title: flags of São Tomé and Príncipe (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that upon independence from Portugal, the flags of São Tomé and Príncipe (pictured), Cape Verde, and Guinea-Bissau all featured the colours green, yellow and red, as well as black stars?

entry.title: Alfredo Gandolfi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that cinematographer Alfredo Gandolfi also had a career as a singer that included more than 300 performances at the Metropolitan Opera?

entry.title: Iloilo Central Market (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the demolition of the Iloilo Central Market was criticized as being unlawful?

entry.title: Henrik Johan Nauckhoff (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Swedish naval officer Henrik Johan Nauckhoff fought against the British in the American Revolutionary War?

entry.title: infant schools (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that nine-year-old children were sometimes employed to help teach younger children in infant schools in the 1840s?

entry.title: Zbrojovka Z 4 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Zbrojovka Z 4 was the first Czechoslovak mass-produced car with front-wheel drive?

entry.title: Ka Esi Le Onye Isi Oche (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that "Ka Esi Le Onye Isi Oche", a 1983 song by Mike Ejeagha, went viral in 2024?

entry.title: Leanne Mohamad (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that despite being an independent candidate, Leanne Mohamad came within 528 votes of defeating shadow health secretary Wes Streeting in the 2024 UK general election?

entry.title: German officials exiled the Samoan king (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that German officials exiled the Samoan king from his own kingdom in 1887?
